Description: Seven joining sherds of shoulder of North Ionian black-figured pottery krater, root of probably ring handle. Interior reserved. exterior slipped cream, with glaze variously fired: base of neck and ridge below glazed; at top of shoulder, except at handle join area, tongues, every fourth or fifth red; below, between bands with added red bands lined in white, animal frieze with incised and blob rosette fill; from the left: dappled deer to left followed by lion with raised paw; boar collapsing to right, facing lion with raised paw; water birds facing across a large and tall palmette; added red throughout.
Curator's comments: 1924,1201.988 is probably from the same krater. Oxford, Ashmolean Museum AN1888.215 probably also belongs. parallels: ist. mit. no. 57, 2007, 186, group B, no. 18, Lentini p. 97, no. 34, naa tested group B; akurgal-kerschner-mommsen-niemeier, p. 178, no. 76 naa tested group b-c - these do not seem close.
Bibliographic references: Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (GG.879)
